stadium.name: The Serpent's Pass
stadium.location: Zmeigorod, just west of the lumber mill
stadium.description: Has to be periodically rebuilt whenever the old stadium starts sinking into the swamp. Don’t worry about it.

stats.pregame_ritual: Rubbing a foul-smelling local mushroom on their elbows for flexibility.
Chugging a raw egg, shell and all.
Performing a series of aggressive, theatrical poses.
Polishing their helmet with a live snail for good luck.
Tensing every muscle in their body at once, then releasing.
Performing a series of aggressive, theatrical poses.
Clapping their hands a prime number of times.
Sharing a ceremonial, non-alcoholic grog from a communal cup.
Looking each teammate in the eye and giving a single, firm nod.
Giving the Trollball a heroic backstory before each game.
Painting a single, matching stripe of mud on each player's face.

stadium.name: Fletchings Field
stadium.description: Fletchings Field was the first formal Troll Ball stadium in Warden lands. The design balances wood and stone, with arrowhead motifs and banners representing each region under Warden protection. The field includes trees, gully's and other obstacle placements, changed each match by local druids and terrain crafters.

stats.pregame_ritual: Going over the game plan drawn in the dirt with the team captain.
Leading the team in a synchronized chant that slowly gets louder.
Wearing their boots on the wrong feet during the warm-up.
Wearing their boots on the wrong feet during the warm-up.
Giving the Trollball a heroic backstory before each game.
Headbutting their own team's goal post (gently).
Sticking a specific type of feather in their helmet's plume.
Burying their helmet in the ground and then digging it back up.
Reading their own fortune in a scattering of knuckle bones.
Wearing a specific, garishly colored pair of undergarments.
Always putting on their left gauntlet before their right.

preGame:
Holy mackerel, folks! Step right up and hold onto your souls! It is Game Three of the Osterra Playoffs, and we are coming to you live from the sinking, stinking, and absolutely sensational Serpent's Pass! I'm your host, Nok the Corrupter, and boy, do we have a doozy for you today! The series is tied up at one-all, and the atmosphere is so thick with tension you could cut it with a rusted seax! The local darlings, the Zmeigorod Snessengers, are looking to defend their swampy turf against the wood-walking warriors of Oak & Onslaught! Winner takes the series and stays in the winner's bracket, while the loser gets a one-way ticket to the losers' side of the map! What a day for some beautiful brutality!

I just got a look at the pre-game warm-ups, and the dedication to the craft is simply demonic! Over in the Snessengers' dugout, Evalyn Pierrepont is giving his helmet one last spit-shine with a live snail for good luck—let's hope that mollusk doesn't have a slow-down effect on his running! Meanwhile, the Onslaught's own Wynnie Faina is staying true to form, trotting around with his boots on the wrong feet! It’s that kind of tactical genius that makes this game the greatest spectacle on the plane! And don't forget Hole Bowerman, who just finished digging her helmet back up from the mud. She looks ready to bury a few opponents next!

The fans are packed in like ghouls in a crypt, and you can really feel the love for the Snessengers today! The Bog Queen herself, Valos the Eternal, must be watching from the shadows, while the Warden's Watch keeps a stern eye from the treeline. Fletchings Field might be where the Onslaught usually plays, but they’ve traveled deep into Zmeigorod territory now. Between the altitude sickness and the threat of a sudden rockslide, these players are going to need more than luck to survive! It's do or die, sink or swim, and I personally hope someone sinks! Let’s get to the action!
postGame:
What a game, ladies and gentlemen! What a defensive masterclass! I haven't seen this much grit since I was trapped in the Demon Prison! The Oak & Onslaught have done the unthinkable! They walked into the heart of the swamp, stared down the Bog Queen’s favorites, and walked away with a 1-0 victory to take the series two games to one! The Zmeigorod faithful are as quiet as a tomb, and frankly, it's music to my ears! The Snessengers might be the most popular kids on the playground, but today, they got their lunch money taken by the Wardens’ finest!

The first half was a whirlwind of missed tackles and frantic scrambles. Ema Ulrick got things started by snatching that leather head in Center Field, but the defense was tighter than a money priest's grip on a copper coin. Northway Orran, that theatrical titan of Zmeigorod, didn't waste any time showing us why she's feared, absolutely leveling Normi Glaudia and sending him to the dirt with a ringing in his ears! It was a beautiful hit, folks, the kind that makes you glad you’re watching from the safety of the booth!

But the Onslaught didn't blink! After Milt Casady launched a pass that went as wild as a drunken pixie, Affra Yanaton was there to scoop it up in the Home 2-Point zone. The Snessengers tried to shut it down, with Northway Orran dealing another crushing blow to Milt Casady, but the Onslaught had a trick up their sleeve! Abner Seidel—likely inspired by his garish undergarments—lofted a perfect pass to Millham Evangeline right in the End Zone! Millham caught it with the grace of a falling gargoyle and dunked it home! That’s the point, folks! The only one we’d see all day!

Zmeigorod tried to fire back, but the luck just wasn't on their side. Evalyn Pierrepont, snail-polished helmet and all, managed to flatten Affra Yanaton, but they couldn't turn that violence into points. Alded Sanjay thought he had a breakthrough with a pass, but Wynnie Faina, despite having his boots on the wrong feet, snagged an interception that had the away fans cheering like madmen! It was a defensive display for the ages!

By the time we hit halftime, the field at Serpent's Pass was looking like a disaster zone, and the altitude was clearly starting to get to the players. After the break, the Snessengers came out swinging—literally! Evalyn Pierrepont took a shot from Center Field that would have been legendary if it hadn't missed the goal by a country mile! The frustration was mounting, and you could see the Snessengers' civic pride starting to crumble like old parchment.

The second half turned into a literal meat grinder! Delija Dowling, likely fueled by that raw egg he chugged earlier, absolutely obliterated Abner Seidel! But the Onslaught just kept coming. Every time the Snessengers tried to advance, they were met with a wall of Warden wood. Northway Orran tried another distance shot from the 2-point line, but it sailed wide, much to the chagrin of the Bog Queen’s loyalists. It’s hard to score when you’re too busy looking for your teeth!

Then came the wave of injuries that really sealed the deal. Gere Cordelie, Northway Orran, and Kleinstein MacGregor started handing out KOs like they were candy at a fey circus! Ema Ulrick went down! Symer Crissy went down! Even Milt Casady got sent back to the healer’s tent! It was a glorious, bloody mess! At one point, I thought Waldon Tadeo was going to run out of mushrooms to rub on people's elbows!

But through all the carnage, the Snessengers simply couldn't find the basket. Arni Griffith and Northway Orran were relentless with the hits, eventually knocking Teria Ravo out of the match as well. But even with a numbers advantage, the Onslaught’s defense held firm. Millham Evangeline and Hole Bowerman stood like ancient oaks, blocking every attempt the Snessengers made to reach the End Zone.

In the final moments, the tension was high enough to make a demon sweat. Avaria Revell tried one last desperate move, but the block from Wynnie Faina was the final nail in the coffin. The whistle blew with Hole Bowerman clutching the ball, and just like that, the series belongs to Oak & Onslaught! They move on, and the Snessengers head to the loser's bracket to think about what they’ve done!

Take that, you heroes of the Grove! You might have the fans, and you might have the Bog Queen, but today, you didn't have the points! Sir Randy and his Rangers are going to be celebrating tonight, while Zmeigorod sinks a little deeper into the swamp! This is Nok the Corrupter, reminding you that in Trollball, popularity doesn't save your ribs! What a series! What a finish! Goodnight, Osterra!
